p: In this study, all spirooxindoles 6a–p herein reported were evaluated for their potential FRAP. The results were expressed as µM Fe 2+ equivalents and presented in Table 6, where the higher µM Fe 2+ equivalents value means higher FRAP and subsequently higher antioxidant capacity. As in the above DPPH assay, both spirooxindoles 6a and 6 m exhibited the best FRAP activity (11.98 and 12.13 µM, respectively) that is comparable to the activity of the reference Ascorbic acid (13.42 µM). Moreover, compounds 6c–6f, 6 h–6j, 6 l and 6n–6p possessed good reducing capacity in this assay with FRAP range: 10.12 − 11.90 µM.
